title: Statistics and Data Analysis

vocab.definition: The collection, organization, and analysis of numerical data
The average of a set of numbers, found by adding all values and dividing by the count
The middle number in a set of data when arranged in order
The number that appears most often in a set of data
The difference between the highest and lowest values in a data set

teachingNotes: Use real data sets that students can relate to. Practice creating different types of graphs. Discuss when each measure of central tendency is most useful.

sample.question: What is the middle number in an ordered set of data called?

truefalse.question: The mean is found by adding all values and dividing by the number of values.

multiplechoice.question: What is the mode of this data set: 3, 5, 7, 5, 9, 5, 2?

fillintheblank.question: The difference between the highest and lowest values is the ________.

shortanswer.question: Find the mean of these test scores: 85, 92, 78, 95, 90.

wordProblems.question: A basketball player scored these points in 5 games: 12, 18, 15, 21, 14. What is the range of his scores?
